name: Powerhouse of Clean Energy
title: Leading in Renewable Energy Usage
description: In 2023, Iceland utilized 89.33% of its total energy from alternative and nuclear sources, showcasing its commitment to sustainable energy solutions.

name: Electricity Galore
title: Highest Electric Power Consumption Per Capita
description: Iceland's electric power consumption reached 50,082.75 kWh per capita in 2023, the highest globally, reflecting its robust energy infrastructure.

name: Water Wonderland
title: Abundant Freshwater Resources
description: In 2021, Iceland boasted 456,351.34 cubic meters of renewable internal freshwater resources per capita, leading the world in water availability.

name: Financial Inclusivity Champs
title: Universal Financial Account Ownership
description: By 2021, 100% of Iceland's population, including the poorest 40%, older adults, and those with secondary education, had financial accounts, ensuring widespread financial inclusion.

name: Education Excellence
title: Top Primary School Enrollment for Girls
description: In 2016, Iceland achieved a 99.37% net enrollment rate for females in primary education, highlighting its commitment to gender equality in education.

name: Persistence Pays Off
title: Perfect Male Persistence to Grade 5
description: By 2021, Iceland had a 100% persistence rate for males reaching grade 5, indicating a strong educational foundation for young boys.

name: Water Wise
title: Minimal Agricultural Water Usage
description: In 2021, only 0.11% of Iceland's total freshwater withdrawals were used for agriculture, showcasing efficient water management practices.

name: Green and Clean
title: Low Agricultural CO2 Emissions
description: Iceland's agricultural sector emitted just 0.0008 Mt of CO2 in 2023, highlighting its commitment to sustainable farming practices.

name: Youth in Action
title: High Youth Engagement in Education and Employment
description: In 2023, only 2.62% of Icelandic female youth were not in education, employment, or training, reflecting strong youth engagement.

name: Healthy Start
title: Low Incidence of Low-Birthweight Babies
description: In 2020, only 3.99% of births in Iceland were low-birthweight, indicating good maternal and infant health care.

name: Safe Childhood
title: Minimal Child Mortality
description: In 2023, Iceland had a probability of 0.2 per 1,000 for child mortality among ages 5-9, showcasing excellent child healthcare.

name: Educational Excellence
title: Low Pupil-Teacher Ratio in Preprimary Education
description: With a pupil-teacher ratio of 4.77 in 2015, Iceland ensures personalized attention in early education.

name: Forest Guardians
title: Negligible Forest Depletion
description: In 2021, Iceland's net forest depletion was valued at just $27,386, reflecting strong conservation efforts.

name: Resourceful Nation
title: Minimal Natural Resource Depletion
description: In 2021, Iceland's natural resources depletion was a mere 0.0001% of GNI, indicating sustainable resource management.

name: Generous Giver
title: Significant Net ODA Contributions
description: In 2022, Iceland provided $94.38 million in net ODA, demonstrating its commitment to global aid.
